kGwZtsFO1tBM9_1A0dOWpg.text: Happy hour was amazing. Great prices for drinks and tons of tasty food items.  Service was great. I forget the gentleman working behind the bar, but he was on point. Food came fast and was delicious and the drinks were cold.  Great place and great people. Definitely a for sure spot in old town.

UwMzqOw5Wv44rJlTUkHOjA.text: This place has awesome drink specials on the weekends! Bloody Mary and Dr. Funk were both awesome! For breakfast, I had the ahi tuna Benedict. It was not my favorite but I still enjoyed it. One thing I did love and will return for is the sweet potato fries and hula sauce! Love that hula sauce! Service was good and quick and I liked sitting out on the patio!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dr Funk
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ahi Benedict

WMhZvbqYq0yb3aRhOX97Ug.text: I was in the other weekend and had a great time. Mick and Lisa are the best bartenders I've ever had. They were very attentive, gave great recommendations on food and drinks, and we had a fun conversation. Cocktails and food are tasty and service is awesome. I wish I could give Mick and Lisa 10 stars as they made our experience so much fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lobster bisque, spicy edamame, sliders.

5WvRuzeRbqYt8qMBhPP6bQ.text: Great spot in the heart of old town. Met some friends there on a Wednesday for Happy Hour. We were happy to find out happy hour on Wednesday goes until close!    We had mai tai's and 'Painkillers'. The Mai tai was Close to what we have had in Hawaii. It wasn't the same, but closer to the flavor than others we have tried.  The sweet potato fries were crisp and has a great dipping sauce. We also tried the pork sliders and they tasted good. All in all a good value for the price. It was also nice to see they had the Maui brewing co beers on tap.   What I was most excited about is the crowd. It was a more mature crowd with people in their 30's to 50's. I'm glad it wasn't the typical younger party crowd you find in old town. It was busy but wasn't loud or obnoxious.   We will defiantly be back... on a Wednesday night.

pUs6bn7VrXvdvetiKQ6HKA.text: Coconut shrimp rolls were yummy.  Especially the pineapple horseradish dipping sauce.   The spicy thai chicken bowl was room temp, I think it may have been due to the sauce squirted on top.  The bowl had an over abundance of rice so if you are a white rice eater this bowl is for you.   The avocado on this bowl was not very fresh.  It was already browned an bruised and didn't look very appealing, but it didn't taste bad.  The two slices of sweet plantains were really good.  Overall the bowl lacked taste and was not spicy at all so don't let the name deter you it was pretty bland.  My husband ordered the  Loco Moco which is a hamburger patty covered in mushroom gravy on top of white rice with two sunny side up eggs on top.  It was pretty, hamburger was medium rare at best so if you want done more than that be sure to specify (because we weren't asked). He said it was ok but lacked seasoning.  I do not like rare meat or eggs so I passed on trying it.  Friendly service.  Not very busy, has a full bar and ample parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spicy Thai Chicken Bowl
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Loco Moco
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar area

xcgnL25qXL05W3droE3NdQ.text: We went twice. Once for drinks, once for food and both were great experiences. Tonight we had Courtney as our server. Didn't write anything down and did not mess up the order.  I had very tender Mongolian beef skewers. The dipping sauce was worth the trip alone. Also a dinner salad. The house dressing is delicious! Hubs had the pulled pork plate. So much food. He loved it. This place is always busy. Happy hour is from 10:30 to 6 daily. You won't regret it.

VCSY5dRUM1Of7tykKMxang.text: I think I found my new favorite restaurant in Scottsdale. I came last night (Wednesday is All Night Happy Hour) and had spicy edamame (best I've ever had), dark & stormy cocktail and the ceviche. Everything was so good, but the ceviche wasn't my favorite, but I ate it all because it didn't lack flavor. I decided to come back for lunch today. Spicy edamame AGAIN, dark & stormy AGAIN, and the ahi poke (so delicious). Within walking distance of my hotel, so it is absolutely perfect. Staff is great too, although the bartender last night seemed more concerned about chatting with friends/regulars than taking care of the rest of his bar, but overall nothing to complain about.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Both and my dark &amp; stormy
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spicy Edamame (my fave)
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ahi Poke with wonton chips

Tza3PQ756zAhOx6o9ju54A.text: Hula's is a great spot for a yummy meal with an island vibe! I've been to the Central Phoenix location a few times but this was my first visit to the Old Town Scottsdale location. Deets on the eats:  -Pink Bikini Martini: tasted like a watermelon jolly rancher! It was sweet and tangy, but I definitely could not have had more than one (probably a good thing!)   -Mai Tai: My boyfriend ordered this drink. It was a bit too strong for my tastes but he really enjoyed it.   -Ceviche: Really tasty! The fish is nice and fresh and comes served with crispy wonton chips. The citrus in the dish was a nice touch but I think it could have been toned down just a tad.   -Mongolian Beef Bowl: Great flavor! The bowl comes with grilled beef, black beans, rice, shredded cabbage and a lime curry sauce. My one complaint is that it's served in a huge bowl that's 75% cabbage. I have had this dish once for takeout and it seemed way more proportional. In the restaurant, there was just a few bites of beef and I wanted a bit more as it was so tasty!  -Duke's Pork Luau Plate: this dish features pineapple pulled pork with a soy glaze, rice, and coleslaw. Super flavorful!   Our server was very attentive and the food came out very promptly. I will definitely be back to try more from their extensive menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Duke&#39;s Pork Luau Plate
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mongolian Beef Bowl
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pink Bikini Martini

Gp1qnU2n3WWgjpVA427zrg.text: Came here for brunch on a Sunday. We were seated immediately as it wasn't that packed the time we went. They have a brunch menu but you can order other entrees or starters if you want.   We got the chicken satay with peanut sauce for a starter. That was really good! Peanut sauce was seasoned just right and a perfect addition to the satay.   For our meals, I got the Hangover Hash & my date got the French toast. The French toast was delicious, it came with apples and plantain and a side of bacon. The hangover hash had pulled pork, shredded potato hash, and two sunny side up eggs. The hangover hash was just alright, pull pork was juicy and perfectly cooked but definitely lacking flavor. Dish was bland to say the least. They did try to season it with onions and red peppers but had to add bbq sauce and sriracha to make it taste good. But once I added that it tasted amazing!   For drinks I had the tropical itch and my date had the Mai Thai. The Mai Thai was sooo good! The tropical itch is good if you want something really sweet and not too strong.   I would come back another time to try other things though.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hangover hash, just needs some more flavor!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken satay w peanut sauce
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mai Thai

bI4HhDXRe2gsjg6zNZlNAg.text: The standout feature of this place to me was how you can 1) pick your fish and the  2) pick how it's prepared, as in toppings/flavors. I chose the snapper, prepared with macadamia encrusted. I was impressed. It was a very decent sized piece of fish, plus the slaw that came with it was unique and delicious. I can't say anything stellar about the side of rice. I guess I sorta would have liked to see something more special, granted rice seems to be a good pairing for this type of dish. The atmosphere, drinks, and apps were all great as well. I would recommend stopping by here if you're in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qWePoh8PlxWELGOu_LPGiQ.text: Awesome drinks & food - especially the vegan options! My tofu salad was delicious & my husband's tofu curry bowl, was great, too. We had a large group on Saturday night & they handled it flawlessly! I would also highly recommend the large shared drink with the 151 topper - sooo goood! Can't wait to return!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tofu salad - excellent!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. prettiest drink!!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tofu curry bowl - yum!

K35ovkfh0_rRPRtOHmCsEA.text: We stopped in after a spring training game on the recommendation of a store owner. We are glad we did! Great happy hour prices and appetizers. The pork tacos are AH-mazing!  Their "take" on the Mai Tai is delicious.   Their theme is "Modern Tiki" so it's a pretty sleek interior. Large bar area with good spacing between the chairs. I never got that crowded feeling.   Bathrooms are clean. They have an open patio so you can bring your pooch.   If I am in old Scottsdale again I will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Divine mai tai!

zqbWh-MLAiM03heT4fYF7g.text: Nice open space.  It was a good place to get a few drinks. We came here with a group and had two rounds of drinks.  The bar was a good place for our group.

J4Rn08SVWOMCwSQjYEPuoA.text: Great happy hour!! Food and drinks are on spot and the service by Tyler was outstanding

7PPqAWHYAOYe9K6HiO8aPA.text: Based on a recommendation I ordered the steak sandwich.  To be honest I had the bar set relatively low since most places that serve a steak sandwich are just meh.  Here it was actually very good.  The mushrooms and grilled onions were a good addition.  The spicy aioli*  was good.  Fries were good.  *Just a comment...what's up with the trend of calling mayo aioli (yes I know what aioli is).

IhiIcSgWGwE7WfSKVMWMpw.text: We liked the other location, we really like this one as well. Right in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale, little seating area outside, doors open for the perfect weather today. Started with fried shrimp rolls. Tasted most of fresh coconut, a little greasy. Fried plantains good, could have those for dessert. Wife had fish tacos, enjoyed them. I had the Hula burger. Big, perfectly prepared, on a fresh, soft ciabatta bun. Delicious! Sweet potato fries, and a nice green salad came with.  Took half the burger and fries home for breakfast.  Splurged on dessert, their sundae. Quality vanilla ice cream, chocolate syrup and crushed macadamia nuts. What a treat.  Nice atmosphere, would enjoy bringing friends.  Got here on Sunday, in time for brunch, but before 3:30 dinner menu. Be advised, I wanted their scrumptious ribs, but not available.  Next time !

w0tnaGo9renRGfS7klxzGw.text: Stopped in to this little gem on our way into town. The Hapu with a macadamia nut crust was superb. Super mild fish and not gamey at all. The rice served on the side was sticky but not pasty and the coleslaw (not cream based) had a mild flavor.  I preferred the fruity salsa with my rice rather than on top of the fish. Added flavor to the rice and but kept the crust on the fish crispy. The lilikoi margarita was tasty as well. There's a bit of OJ in it so it has a "bite" to it. All in all a good place to check out with lots of Hawaiian style items on the menu. Hoping to visit again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hapu fish with macadamia nut crust. Side of rice and coleslaw.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mai tai (left) and lilikoi margarita (right)

KL4lhhukFIs64g7BvIcovQ.text: Perfect combo of great food and beverages in a nice atmosphere. Busy Wednesday night. You will sit close to your neighbor. We had calamari (not my daughter's favorite). If you like thick calamari with less batter, this is for you. Pork and ahi tacos were very fresh and a great taste combo. A bit spicy and a bit sweet. The best part?  Homemade coconut cream pie. Lots of fresh coconut and a creamy taste. Would visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. So much pie - the pie won.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ahi taco
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork taco

7AYPXm8zuyg3P8ngsuk3OQ.text: This place has great food and a fun atmosphere. Definitely worth checking out if you're staying at the Valley Ho. Short walk.

DL5QSAiwxnaqwHtqD_qz6g.text: all day happy hour on drinks! Saturday happy hour is great. We ordered the scorpion bowl for 4 and loved it!

ou_F6IBlNcmOqCrJiLpRhw.text: Hula's has been a successful place for me to catch up with friends, join friends for a birthday get-together, or attend a large work happy hour. In all occasions, I've had a wonderful time!   On Wednesdays, they have HH pricing all night long! So really, you're getting chill bar prices, with a more upscale, dining restaurant vibe.   In my several visits, I've tried their potstickers, their fries, chicken wings, and the Hula Burger - all wonderful!   The Hula's Hurricane is really refreshing...dangerously refreshing, and the house margarita is delicious as well. You really feel like you're getting your money's worth with their quality.

_Y4mhIE5o8K428MoSLv2ng.text: The chicken wings are soooooo good! However my spicy Thai Chicken Bowl was terrible, so I ordered another dish hoping it would be better. Don't worry, I paid for both of the dishes and didn't send it back (I'm not the send back kinda gal). It was gross too! Wth?! Jerk chicken slop with rice. :( so sad. I had high hopes. Someone else ordered the fish tacos which they said were decent. That was a really expensive bill for not eating any of it. Sigh...

VlQJxRbx5itzftxnJn2rqQ.text: I returned to Hula's for a second try, and I was totally impressed. The scene was vibrant and the service was top notch - even the manager recognized his server was very busy and stopped over to check in with us. The food was awesome, and the portion plentiful - I had the Jamaican Pork Plate. I couldn't get enough of it! We also ordered the crunchy spicy chicken tacos, which weren't very spicy, but I understand some don't like things as spicy as others...I suggest kicking it up a notch! I can't wait to return to try more things on the menu. Big thanks to the owner for reaching out to me after my previous experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jamaican pulled pork plate. Amazing!!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

9fTUEeZpzTgQUyykYIApKA.text: I'm glad they are open now in Scottsdale.  It saves me the drive to Phoenix.  Their servers are friendly and the mai tai is as good as ever!

O0DLre9fnh_i7RLlsbe64w.text: Love the concept of a Hawaiian restaurant; it's an original idea. The drinks are lots for fun too and add nicely to the theme. And the food--surprisingly pretty tasty! Got the fish tacos and was not disappointed! Cute decor too!

l1YtLHA8MsZWOxUeEqf0fw.text: First of all, Tyler is hands-down one of the best servers I've ever had. He's pleasant, well-versed on the menu, and committed to excellent service. Ask for a table in his section... On to the food: my bf had the steak sandwich cooked medium-rare and said it was outstanding. I had the macadamia-crusted mahi mahi with a papaya salsa and it was also great. If you're into dessert, try the "pot brownie." Don't worry, it's legal.

D7lsXJKjN8BHd24Olk5xkg.text: I stopped here with a few friends on an impromptu "tour de old-town" before I make my move to SF.  We had no idea it was the grand opening - happy hour all day!  I'd been meaning to try the Phoenix location forever so I was glad I got to check out the new spot.  From what I could tell, this location is much less "themed" which is kind of a bummer, but we still got umbrella's in every drink which made me a happy little bar hopper.  We didn't try any food but the drinks we're all very strong and tasty.  One mai tai was enough for this little one, 2 would've sent me dancing across the street at Pattie's.  Definitely a fun new spot to check out for something off the beaten path!

DEZBPzHJphpKzkDbStLnkQ.text: Great place for brunch with the old town Scottsdale vibe.

tNtzG0fa7s9CCxgoZyN-cg.text: I've been meaning  to try this place , I'm happy I finally got to stop in. The food here is pretty good ! I had the Jamaican pork and my date had the ahi tuna. We were both satisfied with our choices. I loved the Maui pineapple wine , it was absolutely amazing. The service was just fine and not overbearing. The atmosphere of this restaurant is fun I like how they have and open patio. However I did not enjoy the rude /standoffish hostess. I understand people have off days but damn she was unfriendly. So much so my date even mentioned something. Anyways check this place out it's well worth it!

Fa5NLca8fwgoA5cKDRATtw.text: If I could give this place more stars I would! I'll start with our exceptional service! We were here a few  a few months ago when my husband was interviewing, since then, we have moved here and rave about this place every chance we get. Tonight's experience was on par! The staff is always, always friendly! I have gotten the bowls here in the past  they are delicious and very filling! We started with the Crunchy shrimp roll and spicy fish cakes. Both were great starters. I love the mango puree sauce that comes with the shrimp rolls! Tonight I got the kalbi rib. They were cooked just right and full of flavor! My husband got the pork tacos which were cooked and seasoned to perfection! Our friend got the jawaiian pork plate- it was tender and had a nice kick. You can't leave here until you've had their key lime pie! Perfect combo of tart and sweet. It was a drive, but worth it. Tyler took great care of us. We will definitely be back!

0Rf1Z8ZkoGA9JNgXUkj2aw.text: Great food for decent prices.  The hula burger was pretty well cooked and I'm definitely considering coming back

GP-lAACG9nPYs8dxQTWOQA.text: Sunday brunch is nice, $2 mimosas. Lunch menu is available as well, reasonable prices, especially for Scottsdale. Service great, terrific food, very comfortable ambiance. Would've been a 5 star review if food was hot, not warm, when served

CUt41Fy1-d6VGoBno3EsLw.text: Had a great experience. Was at Scottsdale for the SF Giants Spring Training. Food was excellent. Went there for dinner, and literally went back the next morning for breakfast. Juan Carlos was our waiter Sunday morning. Great guy.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great meal after a night of drinking. The Hangover Hash.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. CocoJoe&#39;s Chicken Plate. Sooo good!

19W8QTJemHq0hneCSgeTaQ.text: Don't go for the food. Maybe the drinks are pretty good and boost the rating. We had the Hula Hash breakfast scramble. It was eggs, has Browns and pulled pork. No sauces to make it interesting. Very bland said my wife who ordered the same thing.   Kids food was equally as tasteless.   We will never go back.

_MrQysLXul3ODrK0UhFo-w.text: I've eaten at Hula's before, being a local of Scottsdale, and the food is okay. However after my most recent trip, I won't be returning to this location again. The restaurant wasn't nearly as busy as some of the surround restaurants, and when we walked in the waitress (without acknowledging us at all) placed us at the table. We had plenty of time to review the menu before I stated to noticed that two couples that had been seated after us had already been waited on. Multiple staff members walked past our tables as we had now clearly folded up our menus and were now ready to order. We weren't even offered water!!! After sitting for 20 minutes at the table, clearly looking around for someone to at least take our drink order, we left.  What upset me the most was the hostess. The hostess stand has a bar directly behind it where she was rolling napkins with tableware and has visibility to all of the tables. She just stood there and watched us be ignored. Multiple wait staff approached her to ask questions and she never directed anyone to assist us. I get it, maybe none of them were supposed to wait on our table, but lady you sat us there. Why had you not checked to see why we weren't waited on? I'm incredible offended being blatantly ignored. So save yourself the trip and the Scottsdale attitudes and go someone actually worth your time.

ZcQdVwBIelDpn6zzLdAO-w.text: For a new restaurant I think they did very well.  I went on what I believe was their  2nd night of being open. My group started with the spicy edamame, the ceviche, and the house made fries. I'm very picky, the ceviche had a huge thumbs up from the table, as did the amazing fries. I think the edamame could use a BIT of tweaking.  The group all looked very happy with the entrees ordered.  I ordered a green jungle curry bowl, really good kick of spice, which I appreciated.  I don't believe in bland! I'm not a dessert person but they do have homemade desserts I was told by the cutie server girl. I visit Scottsdale for biz, I will go back (and even try the edamame again).

SKstvcbW49pkNUNmp7664w.text: Came here for brunch. They don't have anything but coffee and a small breakfast menu so I ordered the Chef's  omelet. All I can say is that this was completely gone in about 3 minutes because it was sooooo good!!! They prepared it with fresh eggs, cheddar cheese and the most amazing pork I have ever had.  The hash browns were average but I would still come here again just for the meal I had. The decor is trendy. Nice place to grab a bite without a wait.

qUvuuCYFxbHjtAH72X5I2g.text: An update to my review from 5 months ago i forgot to post ....i was pleasantly surprised after I wrote my first review in August that the manager contacted me and sincerely apologized.  He refunded our money back on the bill and also sent me a gift card for a generous amount to eat there again.  I do have to praise the manager for his help and pleasant nature towards my situation.  Great customer service!

uuMUPCAGaXFwsp-QjlmHGg.text: We've had a number of great experiences at Hula, most recently last night with our daughter. The friendly wait staff and greeters are always on hand to answer questions and insure you are having a fun time. They have a number of tropical drinks that are fun to try as well as good wine and beer. Last night we had fish dishes that came out with perfection. We asked to substitute the sides and that was no problem. I asked that my fish just be lightly grilled, again no problem. On weeknights hubby and I love walking over and having a couple of glasses of wine and appetizers during happy hour (they have great specials) and sitting near the bar. Fun atmosphere, casual but a great dining experience! Give it a try!

ptazaaHCZaR_kGEfQ25dMA.text: One of my favorite spots to eat in Scottsdale! Been there 3 times now and it's been perfect every time. I think my favorites so far are the wings- we always get those to start. (My BF and I are wing fanatics and they're yummy here!!) and the Thai chicken bowl.. Omg. I do no cabbage, extra rice and beans and add avocado. YUM. If you like spicy food this is the spot- almost everything has a little kick to it.

9m7NC8bwx3XPWbnvXY8PSA.text: The food was excellent! Even though it says it doesn't cater to kids the waiter was great with our two kids and they loved their food too! Great drinks

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cody with his wings &amp; Hula juice

rl4RTzPG75_VFT63DJsG3Q.text: Charlie....... you rock!   Charlie is a great server, and I have to say that again. You rock! He took care of an ENTIRE large birthday party and still was prompt and attentive to us. The thing that really stood out for me with him was that he was communicative. If more people were communicative in general, I think people would be a lot more understanding and patient.   Anywho, the first thing Charlie said was that he had a large birthday party and he was going to take their orders but he would be right back to us. Understood. When he came back, I told him that was quick and he said that he felt that he took forever..and that well it was just a matter of perception which to me meant that Charlie had his guests in mind.   Okay onward with the food...   Hula's Modern Tiki is located right in Old Town Scottsdale ...and is just what it sounds like. Hawaiian food with a modern twist.   I ordered the Jawaiian Jerk Pulled Pork Entree, which came with rice, pulled pork, plantain and "Johnny Cakes,"   The entree came automatically split in two plates, since we were sharing and I appreciated that the kitchen did that, probably at the direction of Charlie, without even asking. Thank you! The plates were also presentable.   The pulled pork was fantastically seasoned and oh boyyyyy a kick of spice! If you don't like spicy, this WILL NOT be for you. The spice lingers, but is absolutely delicious. The fried plantain was what I expected, and the Johnny Cakes was delicious as well ...it was like a corn cake with plantains.   We also ordered a side of Mac Salad and that was also reasonably priced ($3) and well worth it. It does come cold, which reminds of the modern mac salad you get from the grocery store rather than the warm ones you get a Hawaiian place, but it was still very tasty and rather light and refreshing.   Enjoyed my experience here!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Split portion Jawaiian pulled pork plate and side of Mac
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dYndCHTmzDQzdRhkYWTwsg.text: We had a fantastic happy hour at Tiki's! To start we had Courtney as our server. She has to be the best waitress ever! Exceptional service and so nice! That alone made it great, but wait there's more! The food is so good! Fries to die for, of course the shrimp coconut crispy rolls, little pieces of fish (so delicious) and on & on. I will be back, I so enjoyed everything, wonderful spirit of the people and decor.  I hear it gets loud later but if your there around happy hour it's fine.

qUtV1La3qyRMkk-fxnP6Dg.text: Been here twice and have been very happy with food, service, selection and atmosphere!

_cvWkMs7hjve2IKzNuvSsA.text: I've been here a couple times for brunch now and I'm a little shocked that 1) both times this place wasn't very crowded and 2) the $2 mimosas they serve on the weekends isn't something we're talking about more (see 1).  When I lived in San Francisco unlimited mimosa brunches on the weekends were all over the place & I was a little disappointed that they were far and few in between in the Phoenix area when I moved back here (although in the 3+ years I've been back they've been popping up more). Technically, at $2 each Hula's doesn't do an "unlimited" mimosa deal, but it's just as good (if not better).   The brunch food menu is pretty solid. The first time I came I had the pork breakfast hash, and it was tasty. Last time I was here I had the omelette (which changes regularly). The time I ordered it, it had chicken & avocado (and a few other things), and it was tasty. This place is also pretty affordable. Most brunch items are around $10 and the portions are pretty good size. Both times I was here the service was good.   The regular Happy Hour & dinner menu look good as well, and they have some pretty fun looking tropical drinks.   I'll be back!

0AONgg5ld8NMdEbFhTcwSA.text: We stopped here for lunch and sat at the bar for lunch.  The lady helping us was very sweet, attentive, and offered great service.   I ordered one grilled fish taco and it came with a side of rice and black beans on top.  The rice had a coconut cream drizzled on it.   Tasty fish taco with some spice.  My husband ordered the spicy shrimp Caesar salad and it was definitely a huge portion and flavorful.  Great stop for lunch!

z9WyUiDGw3d9pkG0HCT93Q.text: (Lyrics - Sam Smith - I'm Not The Only One)  Yelp and me, we made a vow For better or for worse I know you wouldn't let me down But the proof's in the way it taste For months on end I've had no doubts  Eating everywhere I wish I could come over now But I know that you'll be there  I say I'm hungry Cause Scottsdale just around the corner But when is Happy Hour I go to Hula's Modern Tiki!  Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale is a 2nd location to the popular Tiki off Central in Phoenix.  Overall, Hula's Modern Tiki still the same concept and design; a 50's style luau with a modern twist in drinks and food.  I came on a late Tuesday night to catch the game and hang with a buddy of mines from Los Angeles.  He was flabbergasted by the prices, "They're so cheap compared to where I'm from", Yes I agreed.  Plus, we have water and I'm sure glad I don't have to over pay for food here in the valley!    Hula has daily Happy Hour specials so check them out, but tonight I shot for a IPA and ordered the Habanero Chicken Tacos while my buddy went for the Loco Moco.  My dish was pretty darn spicy and I'm sure they used just a tad bit of habanero, but it worked with marinated shredded chicken while the crunchy cabbage slaw provided some texture.  The avocado is always a welcome and the sweet aioli balanced it out pretty well.  I didn't even use my salsa since I thought the dish was well put together.  Only thing was I didn't care for the corn tortilla since it was definitely store bought; I rather have it freshly made and would have made this dish kickass!  My buddies dish was a "traditional" Hawaiian meal.  To me it was a Salisbury hamburger patty atop a bed of rice and a fried egg over everything.  He rather enjoyed it, but I didn't really care for it.    In the end. Hula's is still a hot spot for Happy Hour whether in Phoenix or Scottsdale.  The food is a fusion of Hawaiian and Southwest with some modern American funk.  Service is pretty good and overall and solid spot! - Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

jYNHJ-JOlZQgN47MXKUP-A.text: Food and service are wonderful here.  The ambience, pricing and location is ideal for a great eating experience and in the heart of the old Scottsdale buzz.

DlSedrUfUr5svP7HsxeD4w.text: Outstanding! My entire family loved their meals. We had fish encrusted with lemongrass, steak and pork tacos, and Jamaican jerk chicken. Even the side salad was so good. Finale was the coconut cream pie to die for. Different than the typical restaurants recommended and a must try.

rlTn0GANuwLosowSz7nIBw.text: This place is awesome ! Food, drinks and service is right on point. Shout out to the bartender, Ruben, who made us excellent drinks and gave great recommendations.

uzkf4o00bzbb7G4c9wOiiA.text: There's nothing about the interior of this place that says "Polynesian." Nor will you feel like you are in the South Pacific which is the feeling that a Tiki bar is supposed to get across.  Hula's looks pretty much the same as every other Old Town Scottsdale restaurant. The fact that they have "Tiki" in their name is a joke.

jMRHk_dHRxzDnDn6NJAfQg.text: If I could give a Zero I would. First, it was hot and hell. Second, when Ronnie was addressed about the situation he was rude and professional. Then, he wanted the table and told us leave. So rude!  Will never return this place!!!

Q86WJ2Uz-lbrjIn8T7mjYQ.text: Came here for the food and had a couple tiki drinks and i was not disappointed. The drinks were awesome they have a really nice  menu and the appetizers were of the hook. We had some tuna tar tar and it was the best we've had. The bar is really cool looking very modern and highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Check in pick with our tiki drink

XtUYGraTUE-wNDNfH0To1A.text: They were able to accommodate 30 people on a tuesday for a birthday.  I paid on one check to make it easier on them.  However they were a little annoying in requiring all 30 show up before seating us.  I get it but I was gonna pay for everything any ways and with that many people, some are bound to trickle in late.  It did work out fine though.   Food is good. Several vegetarian options for the 3-4 people that don't eat meat.    Food is tasty, island inspired, good quality.  Not extraordinary, but good, and reasonably priced.    Bar is busy with good drinks.  Trendy ambiance and music, which is what I expect in Old town Scottsdale.

whlwX6Mtx1anCf52X93tGw.text: Cool little restaurant bar in Old Town Scottsdale. I have been to the one in Central Phoenix. Both are very interesting places. The food is good and on point. I usually get the Loco Moco. Fairly classic dish with a slight spin that they put on it. If you're in the neighborhood or down in Phoenix and wanting some Hawaiian style food definitely check out these restaurants.

Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside Loco Moco

WMw1gNyUOwWkqdwFK8BCeg.text: Reviewing this place after our second visit. The atmosphere is super chill and relaxing for a daytime drink and/or lunch. The staff is personable and the drinks are great and well priced-- even better if you catch happy hour. The poke appetizer is definitely something to write home about-- I'd be back for that alone. The pulled pork sliders were yummy too.  Such a great staple place.

WyuqaLYjV-vbJUZTu-gPZQ.text: Great variety of food beautifully prepared and reasonably priced.  The fish bites appetizer was a big hit at the table.  I did the steak sandwich and Caesar salad.  It did not have that much meat, but it was tasty (maybe the bread was too big...). My wife's Baja fish tacos were almost to pretty to eat.  Almost... the fist tacos are defiantly worth trying.    Their are dozens of places competing for business in old town and this place is a winner.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak and Caesar. Great sauce on the sandwich.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fish bites... Sooo good.
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fish tacos beautify platted and tasty!

f1JXKvfLlBsO9ieSstlOFg.text: It's been a while since I've been here but met up with a friend for happy hour Got the sweet potatoes fries and pork tacos, Delicious. Great place to hang out and good views of old town. My only complaint was the $6.50 happy hour glass of wine, if you can call it that.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Really? That should be filled half way or more geez!

D6KA7sq5e670hyVn5NF_fg.text: I was presently surprised by how good the food was here. And old town Scottsdale has that perfect setting. Get the Mac salad.

Jg6FoecJwJKWB-o6plo0qA.text: Do a zombie over a mai tai. Way better drink. Hawaiian vs Tiki menu (where's the 60's pupu platter?) but well prepared and excellent service. Blackened ahi was served perfectly- scare the crap out of the fish with the griddle then remove for rare tasty fish.   And hey, treat your wait staff nice. There was this party with a Ed Hardy shirt wearing mo-fo being a rich douche to our waitress. She was fab. Dude was being a douchebro.

ZbxqeOu_SKa_-v8R7HdYwA.text: I have been to Hula's several times, the food is great and the service is awesome (even my mom loves Hula's and she is crazy picky). -Ahi Benedict, the brunch item I didn't realize I was missing...so good. -Hangover Hash, another awesome brunch item that includes their slow roasted pulled pork...wow that stuff is the best. -Spicy Thai Chicken bowl, I find myself thinking about this item often...that sauce needs to be bottled so I can stop thinking about how delicious it would be on everything. If you find yourself on 1st Ave in the afternoon and smell something amazing, yeah that's Hula's. I tell everyone to go there when visiting Old Town!

TSoxBp8n0OsWzw-VlT34pw.text: Hulas was recommended to me by a friend and it was one of the most AWESOME places I have visited in recent memory.  The drinks were STRONG and CHEAP  ($6 cocktails; awesome!), the food was served quickly and delicious, service was attentive and kind.   I came here with a group and we split appetizers amongst ourselves. We sampled the wings, ceviche (the best ceviche I have had!), sliders, beef skewers, and potstickers.  For the cocktails I had the Hawaii 5-oh! and the Painkiller. Both were equally delicious and very reasonably priced. We also had shots of Patron (~$10) which were very generous shots.   Service was amazing, we had a fantastic time. I would 100000% return on my next trip to Arizona.

6y9Zvix99J-zYfbHmx9Img.text: We had a good visit to this establishment after getting a referral from our JoyRide tour guide. I cant comment on the drinks because nobody in our party got one except the ginger ale which is a "house blend" likely a Coke and Sprite mix. My sister was also kinda grossed out at the waitress sampling it with a straw although I explained that was a common practice among bartenders. LOL!  Now let me get to the food. It was pretty delicious. The plantains, one of my favorite side dishes, were cooked to perfection. I had the pulled pork sandwich which was also super tasty. This establishment brands itself as a Hawaiian-Jamaican fusion restaurant and it's definitely that. The jerk chicken plate ordered by a friend had just the right amount of spice and portions were generous. Other dishes ordered were the mango chicken salad, the bean burger, the ribs and the wings. Everyone enjoyed their meals and the prices didn't break the bank.   The service was decent, our waitress wasn't as attentive as I would've liked. Thankfully her colleagues picked up the slack refilling waters and getting other requested items to us in a reasonably timely manner.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pulled pork sandwich with heaping coleslaw and delicious plantains!

FAa_Wd5rtJ8Q99JrGIt0lw.text: Great cocktails and service.   Mai tai had a great balance of sweet and tart.  Painkiller was nicely spiced.   Ask for extra dipping sauces. They gave us two with our very good beef skewers.   Jason, and especially Reuben, the bartenders were excellent.  And so kind of Rueben to sell us for a small fee some outstanding chimi style sauce for our family gathering the next day.  Made my paltry cooking look good. Thanks!  Great experience.

W7gBr2gjJq_zZ4hPRVW39w.text: Definitely not when I expected for a Tiki place.   From first glance, Hula's seems just like another regular "modern" restaurant. However if you want Tiki Drinks, you definitely came to the right place. Me and buddy came here after a late brunch and decided to get some more drinks. The bartender saw us and greeted us right away.  I was very undecided on what I wanted to order which is very rare when it comes to Tiki drinks. I asked the bartender basically what the strongest tiki drink there was and he recommended an their hula Mai Tai. I was surprised until I took a couple sips. Wow..It was definitely boozey but it had the perfect balance of flavor with alcohol. It was just while I needed! Meanwhile my buddy ordered the Bastard and he was enjoying his just as much as mine. I had a sip and definitely enjoyed the complexity of the Whiskey with the Gin.   If I come back to Arizona and want a quick Tiki drink, I'll definitely think about this place. I'd really be interested to try their food the next time too!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mai Tai
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Bastard

Dn8FkUfjMU2mKsp0rtTb8w.text: Cool spot in Old Town Scottsdale for some tiki drinks and Hawaiian/Caribbean inspired food!   I ordered the Dr. Funk for my beverage (vodka, rum, banana, pineapple & OJ - fruity and delicious), and the kalbi ribs for my meal. The plate was huuuge, with three pieces of ribs, giant macaroni mac salad, and rice. The sauce was a little too sweet for my liking, but it was overall a tasty dish.   Service was pretty lame. It took a little while for anyone to acknowledge and seat us, and our server definitely did not want to be there.   Three stars pretty much sums it up!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kalbi Ribs

CGAryjdq35Fq4zD7TSoeqg.text: Our server was quick and attentive, we got 4 drinks for under $30 total during Happy Hour. I really love the themed glassware and the fruits and flavors that combined in to the presentation. The drinks weren't so strong that I felt drunk after consuming 2 in about an hour.  I love the atmosphere of Hula's, it's a fun place for both adults and those closer to 21. They also have a selection of food to eat while enjoying drinks at the bar. There isn't a ton of seating, but it was not very busy on a Monday evening, and we were sat right away. I would definitely recommend Hula's for a parents night out, bachelorette party, or drinks with friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

YNVORknVv6c1dFqikkq82A.text: Been here like a zillion times. Our good friends come weekly and we often join them. Have not had a bad meal here, and if you do, the staff are quick to replace it. They have creative custom cocktails by all kinds of weird names and they will land you on your A--.They do not chintz out on the alcohol. They have Kona beer, too which I like. The manager there is a prince and I thank him for all his assistance as needed. I can never finish all the food here, but that's okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

POoAvIxis72sF2EVpICgNw.text: We came to Old Town with the intent of eating Mexican. But the wait was just too long. So, we walked across the street. I immediately liked the lively vibe of the restaurant and the welcoming attitude of the hostess. Tyler was our server -- and he had great recommendations all around! I had the Mai Thai and Blood Orange Martini (would strongly recommend the martini) for drinks. For apps we had the calamari (it doesn't look like your usual order, more like steak cuts) and the spicy edamame (we enjoyed the heat). Then for entrees we got the jerk pork (not like Jamaican jerk) - mom said the meat was shredded a little too finely and was a tad mushy (she's also Jamaican and it didn't taste as she expected). I had the poke bowl - it had a little too much soy sauce on it, but I like poke bowls, so oh well - with a seaweed salad on the side as my main dish. I would definitely come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Calamari and Edamame
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Seaweed salad
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Poke bowl

6L-hksVVdD9mfOT1MLAw3A.text: Update: I was contacted by the owner to see what they could do to improve their customer's experience. I've decided to give them an additional star for following up on a report of a mediocre experience, it wasn't even bad! I look forward to our next visit!   Good but not great. Drinks were tasty and service was acceptable but nothing stood out as stellar. I would revisit if in the area but won't be making special trips.

nNb0p_rGmlWysDtqKh-ejA.text: Gave this place another try and got a bowl this time! It was amazing! While I don't prefer their tacos, I think the Thai chicken bowl redeemed Hula's greatly!  Plus good happy hour options.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EXy4nKctO__lO_UOe3rejA.text: Overall very pleased with our drinks and meal.  the service was BLAZING fast - literally within minutes (less than 10) of our order, our food started coming out of the kitchen.  we had a variety of their small plates - beef skewers, potstickers, fries (so good)!  we moved on to mains and they were all equally good. the only downside was a very goopy Caesar salad. flavor was there but the lettuce was drowning in dressing.    I wish they took reservations as that would certainly help in such a popular area of Scottsdale.  our server was friendly and efficient.  Good value and a fun place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Goopy Caesar salad.

uIvsFThruv2pMC1JocSFdA.text: Ordered the pork plate and it was delicious. Tons of meat and good flavor. Service and waiter was very good. I can't think of anything that could have been better. Unique menu and flavors.

igZqKKSCEmwMXGG3PpDJ5w.text: One of our favorite places in Scottsdale. They do a respectable job in replicating some of our favorite Hawaiian flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Loco Moco with fried Spam

lonWJBh0cjJeS8eEkZn8GA.text: Second time, similar experience. Great food incredible Location, poor service.   Never received a refill. Rarely caught eye contact with the bartender. Had to get up and find someone to order more food and drinks, despite the bartender being right in front of us, just ignoring us the whole time.   This is such a shame because the food is so so good!   Twice here spending $100+ Will probably come back just  for the food

U_mVSn1J2EpFT7GJNmnJmQ.text: Got a white fish with the lemongrass sauce. It was a good portion size and was very good. Plan to come back again to try out the other combinations

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Whitefish with lemongrass sauce

mLl8U_goc3LU_B1O2nbveA.text: We had a really great time here and our food was super delicious. I tried the Hawaiian local recommendation and my friend had fish tacos. Our waiter was super nice too

WXKe_dLi2P37rR3WpXCS7A.text: I brought my co workers here and they enjoyed it as I did before. The atmosphere is good and calming and the food was very good. Will definitely be back again but personally I like this place and try to go every time.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

-p--_rU5oyCy-13jpbAv4w.text: Cheers to a great first eating experience in Arizona! After landing in Pheonix after a long flight, we settled on Hula after reading some Yelp reviews and wanting ro eat in Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Homemade Coconut Pie
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ceviche
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hilo Sliders

3gZfEfW5H8JSDSFEkV4nCw.text: Honestly one of the better places I've tried in a while. The seasoning on my jerk chicken was perfect and the size of the portion was very nice. The whole experience has left me happy and full. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone in search of somw new flavors and a nice dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jerk Chicken

a67DWaOJvRoHQiOAI4CS3g.text: Some colleagues and I stopped by here for drinks and a late lunch while on a business trip in PHX.  It has a clean, open design that lends itself to a more modern feel which seemed misaligned with its Tiki theme but was still nice overall.  Regardless, the drinks were really great and, for most of us, the food was almost as good.  We had almost half the drinks on the specialties list (no judgments, please) with the best being the Dr. Funk and Hula's Mai Tai.  We ordered both the chicken wings and steak skewer appetizers and both were really great with the wings being the better of the two.  My colleagues got the BBQ ribs and the Korean Ribs and they were both great. I was told by those that ate them that the Luau Pork Plate and the Steak Sandwich were good. Unfortunately, the same could not be said of my Loco Moco as it was disappointing.  It's flavor was bland and I suspect it was due to the mild tasting gravy.  Overall, I would recommend Hula's as a worthwhile place to stop by for a bite and drink but they have some room for improvement with their food.

QhuPRYBPq6bmENAN3T0oAQ.text: Awful food...  Burgers were way over cooked and had no flavor, waitress was really unhelpful. Would never go again.

6jn3UWD4F10P9Y7jb_0m-w.text: Very good for a casual night out in the air!  Coconut tacos are awesome!  And a Dr. Funk...good food...good drinks...nice atmosphere...coffee could be better

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

f87aP0LpCbmcekcX1_TbtQ.text: Ok I would give it only three stars  because I was likely the oldest person here in the place.  I felt "old" around the twenty somethings in the place.  However the staff did not make me feel that way so it would not be fair to say it was A OK when it was likely a nice place to eat.... the drinks are reasonably priced.  I really should not care but I felt that maybe this place was not "for me". We did not have the food so go in and give it a try.  The entrees and main dishes looked really good.

Q8qT74OcJAmMKrvXvrn5uQ.text: Modern atmosphere for sure. Where are the grass umbrellas and hula skirt waitresses? The only thing hula is the cups they serve their really overpriced drinks in. We only had drinks, but admit the food smelled good and the menu was intriguing. We will have to save up to try this place again.

65khH_dj6wPfxDPGqfZxNA.text: Wow...what to say... Mike is just a gem of a bartender. I came in on veterans to have a couple drinks and mike made this day the best Veterans Day to date. The food is awesome. The service? Even better. I promise you hulas won't disappoint. Great times, great food, great people. America...the home of the free...because of the brave.

HYgljFotZwwdc_vqoUWyrQ.text: Fun casual place. Have been coming for a while and I always get the same thing: Spicy Thai Chicken Bowl and the Hawaiian Ceviche. Check out happy hour days and times!

RuQvI_L006N1GHt1wHohvA.text: Best pot stickers in Arizona :) I would also recommend the fish tacos!! Also has such a great atmosphere! Always fun and friendly

jZd_GrPkYOPcTnlX-6_i1w.text: I ate here visiting Scottsdale and it was fantastic! Creative food combinations that were tasting and filling. I had the best lemonade I think I've ever had too!

fqla3IHxA38y6ppUBsRGhA.text: This has to be one of the best restaurants I've ever been to in Scottsdale. The food has been amazing each time. The portions match the price, and the staff has been amazing each time.

CV_2DtT9l_ujgkV43wPWyA.text: We enjoyed a late lunch on a weekday.  As we sat, the waiter made sure we knew that dinner entrees were not available. Lunch entrees were satisfactory. I had a squid sandwich: it was substantial. One friend had a chicken sandwich which he enjoyed. The other had a dish of rice and hamburger patty which could have had egg on it.  My wife had shrimp tacos. We split a side of sweet potato fries.  We were all happy with our lunch. Each couple split a coconut cream pie dessert. My wife and I had tropical drinks which were pretty good. Everything was reasonably priced.  Service was excellent. Of course, when there are only four tables in use (not counting some day drinkers), a waiter can handle things. In any case we were all pleased we tried this place.  It was recommended by a friend's son and it was a good recommendation.  Unfortunately, the music in the background was a little loud and somewhat obnoxious.

2CQL38mwgw9YwmIvV_vw-w.text: Good was good, however service was terrible, it took about 10 minutes to get silverware after they dropped the food. A cup of coffee took 20 minutes and French fries are "a la carte" with a burger during lunch. There's better places to go within a block of this place.

7FNr6XCQ0rUbYbFoKg0zsw.text: Great food and great service.  Four entrees, two appetizers two adult drinks and walked out with a bill under $100 with tip for a family of four.  Kali ribs were great as was the calamari and shrimp rolls.  Our second time here except last time we went to the Phoenix location.  Will be our standby.

WNRvLpDfSyO4ds6gooxxfA.text: Love this place for the food and atmosphere! Service sometimes seems a little slow but then again I am typically there with 10 plus people. Always a good place to start your sunday funday!

nU1s2Jtey8o8sincpy8SRw.text: Just want everyone to know, we Gave Hula's Scottsdale another chance: had a wonderful experience.  Greeted right away at the bar by Rachael.  We actually felt welcome.  Far different experience from the last time.  We will be back.

3hiz75DRa7sQ1EIC-aYZlQ.text: I was so happy when they announced they were opening a location in Scottsdale.  This is a really fun place and I am sure it will be a hit in the area.  There are a couple of kinks still to work out, but I am sure they will take care of it.  We went for the grand opening, we sat at a communal table with several friends.  I was having such a fun time that I missed the ribbon cutting ceremony.  My first drink was the Dr. Funk, very fruity and rummy.  I think it could be dangerous, because I was downing it pretty fast.  My second one was the One Eye Pyrat, I love ginger beer, so I wanted to try it.  That one was good, but I liked my first drink better. To eat we had the Ahi Tuna Wontons, Pork Tacos and Johnny cakes.  Everything was really good.  We never got our sweet potato fries, but they took them off the bill.  It was a pretty confusing table, so I don't blame our server Charlie, he was trying to take care of a table of over 12 people.  I already know what I am getting next, can't wait to be back.

rc-aYIuOgZyA7MaY5Cyrvw.text: Had a nice lunch there.  Even on a warm day the restaurant is very comfortable and airy with the front open.   We ate the shrimp tacos, excellent, the calamari sandwich, good, and the teriyaki chicken.  My only negative is the hot spice that is put on the pineapple that goes on the chicken....  Not mentioned on the menu and an unpleasant surprise for the guest eating it!  Other than that, great venue, attentive service, good drinks, we will be back

9dzvwbgNEiZ5Uc7XYCt1rQ.text: The brunch-Happy Hour is the bomb, I loved the Loco Moco and the Ceviche was off the hook. I will recommend this place to my friends.

RN5rOPe7V14LuqtJOX-Vfg.text: I visited the Scottsdale location after having a great lunch with a friend at the downtown phoenix Hula ocation. I ordered a Pink Bikini Martini, and my husband a Mai Tai, which were fantastic. We also ordered hapu ceviche, which was fresh and flavorful. For dinner we both ordered Ahi Tuna Sandwiches-- which I was sadly disappointed in. The Ahi Tuna was tough with a lot of tendons.. I could barely eat it, honestly. Sad because on my previous visit I ordered the Ahi Tacos, and they were delicious. For $15 for an Ahi Tuna Sandwich, I would expect a better cut of Tuna. My husband wasn't quite as offended about it and he loved his sandwich. I will definitely be back-- the appetizer, drinks, and ambience won me over even if the meal wasn't quite right.

OoL2Nl0Tjs0f3yEW5GyKEQ.text: There was a ton of seating available and the hostesses were a hot mess. Rude, condescending and clearly have a problem seating people.  Happy hour loss on their part.

mBYS9K0ua8L_XuPl1zJISg.text: I'm giving this place 1 star because that's the level of brain activity that the hostess with the black hair and pound-heavy mascara had with me tonight. My friends and I were heavily underquoted on a wait time, then talked to like we were members of her rival sorority (assuming she's not in her 6th semester at SCC). She literally said "I'm like, not sure you guys are gunna get a table"- after we already waited. We elected to help shorten her wait list by removing ourselves from it.

MwGzSL5M-jUUUHuTSREFYA.text: I wish I could be more articulate with my review but there's just no words for the difference in service between the Scottsdale location and downtown phx. As a very understanding,  generous guest with well over a decade in the business I can not think of any reason to try to the Scottsdale location again. Simply awful service time after time . But, if you are ever in the downtown area I highly recommend this restaurant as their food, cocktails, and service are top notch. Family,  friends, and business associates alike will enjoy the experience and I would hate for anyone to be deterred after visiting the Scottsdale location.

QgCPwxfHLlLl_T9o9bY_hw.text: I've been to Hula's a couple of times now and am definitely a fan so I figured I'd write a review.  Pros- Really good food, I recommend the Baja Fish Tacos, and the black bean burger- which is quite possibly one of the best veggie burgers I've ever had! I've been here for brunch too and everything is delicious and Hawaiian themed (cute). Also, GREAT cocktails! I came here yesterday for an event and ordered the Blood Orange Martini, YUM! My friend got the Painkiller and that was amazing too.   Cons- Okay so issue number one, it's sort of a weird layout. Near the bar they have two long tables that are parallel to the bar and even though it makes the space look modern and contemporary, I can't help but feel like it's such a waste of space. I get why they have them, for larger groups, but why not connect the booth's that are toward the front? I don't know, but I felt it worth mentioning since everytime I go here with a different person they say the same thing so it must just feel odd to all. Then again, I majored in design as did many of my friends so perhaps we're more sensitive to it then others. Again, this isn't that big of a deal because at the end of the day the food is great so who cares.   Issue number two- okay, how do I say this without sounding like a bitch? Hmm can't. Can the front desk girls please put on real pants? Seriously! Yesterday I saw a girl wearing worn-out yoga clothes and thought "Really? Who goes to a place like this from Yoga. That's sorta gross." Then to my horror I realized the girl actually worked there. WOW. Unlike the layout, you might want to re-think this one, Hula. You're too classy and cool of a place to allow workers to be greeting guests in what could pass as pajamas. Like seriously, bikinis would be less offensive at least that's in line with the theme.   But again, I come here often and really like it. Those are just my humble suggestions to make this place even better.

5xRyM_fMalwQAs1_o3hZTg.text: Great new spot that has a different atmosphere than most Scottsdale spots.  Worth checking out.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great new place! Staff is great.

VkUjoMwXQV5eag6WHymmQg.text: Great Food and amazing value. The drinks are strong and well priced and the vibe is cool. What more could you want?  Try the appetizers (shrimp rolls and fish cakes)  The tiki bastard and Mai tai are well made drinks here worth trying.

TEy2Vby3FDNegasdKAlfpQ.text: Love that this place takes reservations, loved the greeter and our waiter - couldn't have been more pleasant or professional, loved the food!  Being in Old Town (aka Tourist Central), I wasn't expecting to love it, and in fact we usually end up at Bandera just for that reason.  So glad we tried Hula's Modern Tiki.  Only drawback is lack of parking which wasn't a problem in the summer of course, but there's no way I'd try to find a parking place there in Season.

IOkFtieUjXATort4FOfbyg.text: As with the Hula's on Central, Hula's in Scottsdale is quite nice. I like that it's located slightly off Scottsdale Road so it doesn't seem as intensely busy. I like the layout of the restaurant a lot, and the service is good. As always, can't go wrong with a mai tai. I also like the tofu tacos and their Caesar salad is delish.  If you're touring restaurants in Old Town Scottsdale, give Hula's a go.

XGXjaQZxZJ3TiX8pGSnTUQ.text: Came here twice and both times had the mai tais, sweet potato fries, and tuna tacos. The mai tais are awesome and strong (how I like them) and I would keep coming back for those alone. Sweet potato fries with the dipping sauce were delicious, and tuna tacos were also good.

_MFVVCv5LxrnJJUopJZggw.text: The food was good but it did take a while to come out. Not sure if it was due to Sunday brunch. The tables were also too close together. Location is in a great spot easy for find parking though. Overall it was an ok experience.

k_AyBQYzcEpYn0ms6dla_w.text: Amazing happy hour but get there early as they fill up quickly. Also try the drink "painkiller" its pretty good.

Xo1a-71Nv-Z8jTHZfA7NRg.text: My guy and I were visiting a relative in Scottsdale, and I researched for a good week, looking for a place to have a bite to eat as well as good cocktails. After searching on Yelp for others' opinions, I found this place (originally only knowing about the Phoenix location, but luckily spotted their Scottsdale location). We were there around 8pm, and were seated quickly. The place is smaller than I expected, but wasn't too crowded. We were seated promptly, and made our drink orders. The food was good, as well as the drinks. Service was spot on. I plan to stop by this place whenever we're in town visiting again.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious Mai Tai

jdyA9HZuQ3knvO4v1aHkfg.text: Wonderful friendly atmosphere and I have seen the service improve over the past year. It seems to be quicker & more attentive now. The food is always very consistent and cooked to perfection. Prices are very fair for what you get and seems like some drink is always on special. And of course the pulled pork is really "heaven on a bun"!

btzWxPpG2NbURNuVBLmtnQ.text: AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS!!! Their menu has so much of an variety! Great service and atmosphere too! Hands down my new favorite spot! Highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Key Lime Pie was Delish !!!
Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lemongrass Encrusted Mahi

uXkIZ6XjgRLESwPrWD19dA.text: Came by here after a Giants spring training baseball game.  Though a tiki bar there was none of the kitsch.  It is a very nice space that's front is open to the street.  I rarely drink rum but I had mai tais, which were really good.  We drank and grazed on appetizers for a couple of hours.  This is a really cool place.

BZ_RqIasOW32_LjUczk4EA.text: What a wonderful find downtown! The food was exquisite!  Must have the ceviche and Poke...to die for! Everyone's other meal also looked good. Highly recommend

ELclGG-GtZV873RWUeX5Hw.text: Service was horrible! The server never filled our water glasses at same time even though they were low at same time.  My order was also wrong and instead making a new hamburger they just removed what was wrong with it and did horrible job doing so, so the item was still on burger and then my burger was over cooked and cold and so where the fries. Would not recommend!

1_giBIsbz1cDdTkRwD5cjQ.text: This place never fails. Service is impeccable. The menu, cannot argue. I love this place. Specials are fantastic. Great atmosphere. Just all around fun.

Jjso6CtsTBoE6HmZHjYazQ.text: My new favorite place in old town!!   The drinks are amazing, the food is really good, I love the hula's wings and my husband loves the Cajun burger, he said is the best burger he has ever had and on top of everything they have happy hour on the weekend.   We really really like this place :).

36NNCo6GkAy29hwFHoyzRA.text: The drinks were great but strong, food was either very bland or very spicy, ambiance was a nice outdoor lounge feel. The Scorpion bowl was a good drink but the bowl it came in looked like it was bought in a back alley tourist shop in chinatown...see pics

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Scorpion bowl

pRo6PWptbzC0gAgocrRsDA.text: This restaurant is just AOK...nothing really special about the food or the restaurant. The hula tiki fish sandwich had a thin piece of fish, tasty but not the best. Best part of the restaurant is its location in Old Town Scottsdale...

kZDdwCv-bazNg_AUjHJK0w.text: Wow! Everything was perfect.  First time and can't wait to go back. Next time I will try breakfast, the breakfast menu looked delicious.   Our waitress, Alexis, was timely, made great suggestions and was super friendly.   I almost forgot to mention the Mai Tai. It was easily the best one I've had, one was enough to get you there.  And finally,  the topper, there were no kids there!  This place meets my James Bond test.

fx6ttBTjCFh7gKPcX9whww.text: The name "Hula" makes me think of greasy Hawaiian BBQ but I can promise you that you won't find any of that at this hopping Scottsdale eatery. My friend and I went for lunch and we were pleased that they had their own parking lot (albeit small) and we were surprised that the interior was classy (whereas we were expecting uber casual beachy). Service was prompt and friendly and it was only a matter of time before our lunches arrived - Caesar salad with shrimp rolls and a Polynesian chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries.  The Caesar dressing is amazing so I would recommend any of the Caesar salads here.  The Polynesian chicken sandwich was excellent but definitely a little messy so if you are at Hulas on a first date or lunch interview I would skip it.  :-).  For visitors from colder parts of the country, I can see where they would really enjoy the garage doors that roll up for access to the small outdoor patio and to welcome Sonoran breezes.  Not only is the food good here but the atmosphere is great too.  If you are fortunate enough to be there when the weather is ideal it's reminiscent of a San Diegan or Hawaiian ocean front burger stand.

hvws-CVSWOyFrmiEPOUSsQ.text: Pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw was amazing, Polynesian Chicken Burger !!! . Service was good and prompt, but server was not in her happy place today. If she smiled once I would have gave it 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nice patio , great space !

8bsSx8ChR8XA2yoN6_-lSQ.text: Since my friend loves rum infused drinks we decided to come here for bites on a Saturday afternoon. I'm not into fruity drinks with fluffy umbrellas on them but my friend loved every drink they ordered the crispy coconut shrimp egg rolls. Everything was delicious. I can see myself come back on a Friday and Saturday night to enjoy more of the scene.

BsnWcLmfW3nLPQGzi2m96g.text: I have been to the Central Phoenix Hula's location many times, but this was my first visit to the Scottsdale outpost.  I brought a large group for lunch and everyone enjoyed their meal.  I was especially pleased with my black bean burger with mac salad - so tasty!  Great atmosphere, great service and great food too!

M-LzX7lPr4ULEwIBMGtF-g.text: Incredible food with good service. Also very fairly priced for incredible food. Would go back in a heartbeat. One of the best restaurants I've gone to this year

KVI53bXSvLC3P0iz_CxBJQ.text: I ordered Polynesian chicken sandwich... Taste awful, the chicken taste like rubber and smell fishy. I asked to take the sandwich back and order shrimp taco which taste much better. And our server seems to disappear never comeback to refill our water.

I2S3KC7NgGNFaQs8YjTxAA.text: Great happy hour special on Tuesday! 2 n 2 for $20! We shared 2 apps and 2 cocktails! Great cocktails, fresh seafood!

TaIlEMicwZsQVumgwiyTWQ.text: My wife and I love this place. Both locations are good, though we like the ambiance at the Phoneix location a bit more, they are both great. Their cocktails are good and strong, especially the Mai tai which is not too strong. My wife is vegetarian so there a ton of options for her, some which I even enjoy! For meat eaters, the tacos are great as is the burgers, but my favorite is the Ahi caesar  salad. A huge salad with fresh chunks of tuna mad mangoes, feels like your on the islands in the middle of scottsdale.

Zlf5pJl2ttpuq2vG4ABNNQ.text: Came here for lunch the other day and had a great experience. I got the jungle tofu bowl that came with fried plantains which were delicious. My dad got one of the burgers with egg and mushroom gravy- he cleared his plate! The food is fresh and simple, I really don't think you can go wrong ordering any of the dishes. Our service was wonderful. Lauren, our server, was attentive and friendly and always making sure we were doing okay. I would definitely come back!

MuIC38Q3xJyAA4MlCpktHQ.text: Came in on a Saturday night and this place was definitely happenin'  Positives:  - The luau pork dish was absolutely delectable - Happy hour, even on the weekends! Just get there early - Inventive takes on drinks - Really enjoyed the casual, yet modern atmosphere  Negatives:  - They still weren't taking reservations unless it was for a party of 8 or larger. The hostess did us a favor and allowed us to make a reservation for 6. Even though it was for 8:30, we definitely would've had to wait for at least 15 minutes if we didn't make that reservation...so this policy doesn't make sense - Our server either forgot orders or mixed up orders twice. But she was really nice and seemed to be trying her hardest on a busy weekend  - Tahiti lager; would not recommend - Things were a bit more expensive than I anticipated when portion size was taken into account

39ELh2sPRvJqkcGuh-hcOQ.text: Great atmosphere. Got in early on a weekend and there was no wait. Very good food. Sweet potato fries were the best!

eQnNsEHFO8VGzCC4MfmNug.text: I absolutely love, love, love the food at Hula. The lobster bisque soup, the Hula Burger, the Bowls they're all amazing!  The service was super slow but the server was very nice.  The only thing I would count as a downfall is they're patio is way too small and the inside doesn't have a comfortable atmosphere so the dining experience isn't that great.  Since the food is so amazing I'll probably just do carry out.

2SXUMdKz2xL_RW-co6aYqA.text: Great food & terrific service. We shared potstickers & beef skewers which were tender & cooked perfectly. Our dinner choices included macadamia nut encrusted mahi, a black bean burger, Thai chicken rice bowl & south seas fish tacos. Everyone loved their entree & our huge tiki drinks some of which are huge enough to share.

1M-EI1wUHZvZoaFgxSw5bA.text: Absolutely awesome food & service! We happen to stumble upon the grand opening & went in for a cocktail.  We returned the next day for lunch. Incredible food!!! I asked if Hula's has a sister restaurant in Monterey Ca.?  They do!  The Hula's in Monterey Ca. was one of the best meals we had in Monterey. Scottsdale was just as memorable! You have a serious hit on your hands!!! KUDOS!!!!! Can't wait to go back!

hwx-fHOWfXH2kV6S41uITw.text: We looked at the menu before hand, and saw there was a lot that we [thought] we could eat - being gluten free. We were wrong, it was difficult to find things to eat. What we chose were sweet potato fries and pot stickers. Both were delicious.   The drink menu is enticing and fun! When we got our drinks they were as delicious as the menu makes them out to be. They also had bowls of alcohol to share with someone else.   The environment was trendy and fun. Probably for a younger crowd (early 30's and younger).

93d5zCFI4LcLVjChfYl4Fg.text: This was my first time at this location and I met up with some friends for a quick dinner before we all caught flights out of Phoenix. I wasn't too hungry, so I had a cocktail and the coconut shrimp rolls. The servings here are huge so you could definitely get away with splitting entrees between people. It's a cute place, great for a date night or to catch up with friends over drinks.

CyX9Mz-bK5xfu8cNZKfgVQ.text: Service was great. Juan Carlos was an excellent attentive server. Great personality. Food was good and reasonably priced. Only thing is they give you WAY too much food! But we enjoyed it.

photos.caption: Photo of Hula's Modern Tiki Scottsdale - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Picture of the bar and TV. Looks like a good place to watch sports.

5uxZ_7bgrAiQbjDVEvQBHA.text: What's better than happy hour from 3-11pm on a Wednesday night? Not much! Hula's happy hour on Wednesday makes happy hour during the week possible for everyone. Their pork tacos and crispy coconut shrimp rolls are finger lickin' good. My personal favorite on their entire menu is their abalone style calamari which I like to refer to as their grilled calamari. I crave it all the time! It comes with an amazing lime-ginger cream sauce that compliments the calamari perfectly.   Their brunch menu is also fantastic, I recommend the Hangover Hash, which if you do actually have a hangover, works magic. Otherwise it's just plain delicious. Hula's atmosphere is fun and a nice change of pace for us Arizonans.

yMRW-oxmmye63nJoPx_Z9g.text: We love this place. Fabulous bloody marys!  I enjoyed the ahi eggs Benedict. OMG so amazing!  The menu is so interesting!

zsY4rB15R9UzkC4XasG93A.text: Had lunch there. Ordered the burger. The meat was almost raw. And took almost 45 minutes with only six people in the place. The menu is sparce and "fruity".

PaCg4KhOWKZKmOHDYUVATA.text: I came here for a friend's birthday. It was the perfect spot for a celebratory dinner before heading out to Old Town. I had to do a Mai Tai because...it's their signature! It was awesome. Everyone had great drinks, actually, and our server kept them coming. The service was great even though we had a table of like 15 girls. This is a great choice for a date night, special occasion, or just a Saturday. Loved the fun but sort of mysterious atmosphere.

LI1lQG41YJEQKrKXpg2EtA.text: Incredibly friendly staff for starters! We had an annoying person in our group who ate all her food and then complained that it was gross. Manager accommodated her (and completely kept his cool which I could barely do) and made sure she was happy by the time we left. Our group was a pretty good size and everyone else enjoyed their food and the birthday girl even got some ice cream. I ordered the coconut shrimp rolls and they were on point. Awesome place for celebrating something or just coming in to eat and have drinks.

ncMsRo9_S_fGql3__0SQsQ.text: We had the hangover hash!  It was delicious and we loved the serving size!!!  Great staff and service.

g32eOse-rSv6lhGPBGdnKg.text: Awesome place to meet up with friends for some drinks and food!  I love the downtown location and as soon as I heard there would be a location in Scottsdale, I was thrilled.  Same great concept, same excellent food and service.  The sweet potatoes and taco plates are amazing.  The taco plates come with one or two tacos, and beans and rice.  Brunch is my favorite time to stop in.  The Chef's Choice Omelet is my favorite.  They do have coffee but I would highly recommend getting a double Pineapple Mimosa.  As for other favorite drinks, try the the Dark & Stormy or the Pain Killer.  But all the drinks are worth trying!  They have all day Happy Hour on the Weekends and Wednesday.  Stop by and say hi to Max.

IWPFJDXUQDzYpRzOaxFWkQ.text: I love hulas, my favorite thing are the potstickers I can eat them all day everyday. I took my girlfriend here and every time we come we order at least 2 or 3 of them.

Lhe1qKtxSPJA572XmdHExg.text: Thought I would give the Hula another try. Had the pork sandwich with coleslaw. Short story is the pork was tough as leather and hard to chew. The Mai Tai was a little on the lite side and tart side as well. The server was nice, but after the food was delivered to the table, he disappeared. Can't say that Hula will be a return visit, but who knows.

TQ4imDTX1ccD5jY206LCyg.text: The drinks are excellent, prime location in old town scottsdale. The bowls and pork are recommended. Tried a Tahitian beer for the first time in the Tiki House. Really cool restaurant with a perfect atmosphere.

C00GI-s5OWBTOR2qLc4VFg.text: Have been a number of times, but finally found my dish- the grilled fish tacos.  Perfectly prepared and super fresh every time I have them.  Fish is tender and slightly blackened on corn tortillas with cabbage and a side of black beans and coconut rice.  Really flavorful and healthy! Also last time had a bite of friends ribeye- it was awesome

E2I30J_2qmnLv5lXgyVX7w.text: Got a little taste of home in Old Town, Scottsdale. I ordered the Loco Moco and made the waitress smile when I asked for Tabasco... "You must be from Hawaii!" The food was good. We also tried the ceviche, fish tacos, and the fish cakes: all delicious. I have mixed reviews on the drinks: my drink tasted like plain/bland fruit punch (couldn't taste any rum), while my friend's drink was way too strong (she actually had to return the drink to get it fixed.) At least the margaritas were okay.

p5pAv9sRrxwhGWL4I4geaw.text: The first time I ate here I was with a large group of girls and everything was amazing our service, food and drinks was all great so I recommended it to lots of friends but the second time I ate there it was the complete opposite... Horrific service my good was mediocre and our table was small and we were sat very close to a really big group at a high too and kept getting bumped into

caW0RXhqqrL-_H4-3AJBgQ.text: Good was so good, had the pulled pork sandwich along with a Caesar salad and key lime pie for dessert ... What wasn't the best was the waiter . He seemed to be working the bar along with taking tables .. He also seemed side tracked and he wasn't rude but he wasn't overly happy to see us either ... A little over priced but I may go back one day .

tlQnCqZmKp7YOb8lirPkLw.text: I had a great experience here. My good friend chose to have his birthday dinner here. It was a few of us so we had a bit of a wait to get a table but totally understandable since we didn't make reservations not call ahead. Service drinks and food was great!
